channel.title: Gliese 581g Supporting life?
channel.description:
Well here it is. I'm not too sure if you guys are interested in space as much as I am, but ive been doing a heavy load of research on our Universe and it looks like NASA has surprised us folk again. They have discovered an earth-like planet somewhere around x10 it's size, however it is all completely water, ranging from like 2 million ( i really cant remember what they said, all i remember its a shit ton more than earths sea depths) or so miles under its surface until it reaches the bottom. At this far down, pressure is so great water starts to act up.
so yea thoughts etc
EDIT: The water ranges approx. a quarter of its way into the planet.
DOUBLEDIT: It ranges down approx. 340,000 miles under.
TRIPLEDIT: Here guys. Here's a link to NASA: http://www.nasa.gov/topics/universe/features/gliese_581_feature.html

item.title: Gliese 581g Supporting life?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:43, topic:381942”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=477748.msg3495932#msg3495932 date=1297308028]

I read that saturn’s moon Titus(?) is like a younger earth, has water and could support life in a few million years. I believe they are sending a probe though in 2015, and it should arrive around 2025.

Remember, 20.5 million light years would only be reachable through the use of a black hole, if they are infact portals.

Not to sidetrack this discussion, but that would be so fucking epic to dive head first into a black hole and see whats on the other side. I’d so do that.

I would so do it also. But we need to find one first.
[/quote]
Well, we could be like that farm person in that one movie who made his own rocket ship. We would go look for one then. :)[/quote]

Sweet, so we got the ride. But we need a map to find this black hole. o.O

Read full topic

Just watch in like 10 years we will have moved to this planet…

I think we’re going to be like Bioshock when we are in this planet, if we do move to it.
[/quote]

item.dc:creator: @asyo4 asyo4
item.description:
@asyo4 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Gliese 581g was discovered September 29th '10, though Gliese 581b was found in August '05. That’s where the confusion may come from.

Also, Gliese 581b is a star.[/quote]
Right, right, I haven’t memorized all the 581abc’s lol
